channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: An Avalanche of Generative AI Videos Is Coming to YouTube Shorts
item.description: Google plans to add an AI feature next year inside of the YouTube app for creators to generate 6-second clips using the company’s Veo model.

item.title: Amazon adds PayPal as a payment option to Buy with Prime

item.title: Do You Need an Antivirus Program on Windows?

item.title: Edera is building a better Kubernetes and AI security solution from the ground up
item.description: Edera, a startup looking to simplify and improve how Kubernetes containers and AI workloads are secured by offering a new hypervisor, today announced ...

item.title: 22 Amazon Prime Perks You Might Not Be Using
item.description: Your membership gets you more than free two-day shipping. Here’s what you may be missing ahead of Amazon Prime Day 2024.

item.title: YouTube unveils ‘Hype,” a new way for fans to help smaller creators grow their reach
item.description: YouTube creators no longer have to rely solely on the recommendation algorithm, search results, or collabs to help them grow their audience. At the co...

item.title: Apple iPhone 16 Pro and iPhone 16 Pro Max Review: Smarter iPhones
item.description: Apple Intelligence might be overhyped, but it brings some helpful capabilities to the iPhone.

item.title: Last Week: Amplify your brand by hosting a Side Event at TechCrunch Disrupt 2024

item.title: Laura Loomer Is MAGA at Its Most Extreme—and She’s Closer to Donald Trump Than Ever
item.description: Right-wing agitator and conspiracy theorist Laura Loomer has Donald Trump’s ear. And she has for a while.

item.title: YouTube Studio now lets creators brainstorm video ideas with the help of AI
